publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-7406 Robert Brown: Aung San Suu Kyi—That the Parliament welcomes the release from house arrest of Aung San Suu Kyi; applauds what it considers to be her courage and steadfastness in defence of democracy in Burma over so many years; is appalled at what is seen as the continued repression under the current military junta in Burma, and looks forward to the restoration of democracy in Burma as soon as possible. Supported by: Pauline McNeill*, Rob Gibson*, Liam McArthur*, Sandra White*, Bill Butler*, Robin Harper*, Anne McLaughlin*, Jackie Baillie*, Kenneth Gibson*
S3M-7406 Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 15 November 2010) Ms Wendy Alexander*, Bob Doris*, Ian McKee*, John Wilson*, Jamie Hepburn*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Alasdair Allan*, Mike Pringle*, Gil Paterson*
S3M-7406 Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 15 November 2010) Sarah Boyack*, Jim Hume*
S3M-7406 Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 15 November 2010) Alison McInnes*, Hugh Henry*

S3M-7406 Robert Brown: Aung San Suu Kyi—That the Parliament welcomes the release from house arrest of Aung San Suu Kyi; applauds what it considers to be her courage and steadfastness in defence of democracy in Burma over so many years; is appalled at what is seen as the continued repression under the current military junta in Burma, and looks forward to the restoration of democracy in Burma as soon as possible.Supported by: Pauline McNeill, Rob Gibson, Liam McArthur, Sandra White, Bill Butler, Robin Harper, Anne McLaughlin, Jackie Baillie, Kenneth Gibson, Ms Wendy Alexander, Bob Doris, Ian McKee, John Wilson, Jamie Hepburn, Hugh O’Donnell, Alasdair Allan, Mike Pringle, Gil Paterson, Sarah Boyack, Jim Hume, Alison McInnes, Hugh Henry, Ross Finnie*
S3M-7406 Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 15 November 2010) Linda Fabiani*
S3M-7406 Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 15 November 2010) Ken Macintosh*
S3M-7406 Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 15 November 2010) Nicol Stephen*
S3M-7406 Aung San Suu Kyi (lodged on 15 November 2010) Shirley-Anne Somerville*
